section.section: This section applies to income tax that is imposed by a state other than this State.
This section does not apply to any income tax that is imposed by a political subdivision of another state.

text.section:
Subject to subsection (c) of this section, the Central Payroll Bureau shall:
withhold income tax imposed by another state from the wages of a State officer or employee who is a resident of that state; and
pay over the amount withheld to the appropriate tax collecting agency of that state.

This section applies only if:
Maryland State income tax is not required to be withheld from the wages of the officer or employee under Title 10, Subtitle 9, Part II of the Tax - General Article; and
the state where the officer or employee resides:
withholds Maryland State income tax from the wages of Maryland residents who are employed by that state; and
pays over the amount withheld to the Maryland State Comptroller.
